content: Product Review: Google Pixel 4G Lte 32Gb Slate Verizon Cell Phone, it is a great piece of technology.
Pixel Tablet Review: Is Google Back?! It seems like Google is trying again, which is positive.
Most reviews indicate the Google Pixel Slate is bad, sharing a similar negative sentiment regarding its performance and usability.
Many reviews highlight hardware problems that are overshadowed by the significant software issues of the Google Pixel Slate.
The Google Pixel Slate's software is a disappointment, hindering its potential as both a tablet and laptop device, which is very unfortunate.
The Google Pixel Slate has some glaring issues, especially considering its current price point, which makes it a difficult recommendation.
The Google Pixel Slate is somehow marketed as a tablet-first device. I am not sure why this is the case, given its limitations.
Google discontinued the Pixel Slate tablet line. It represents a weak commitment to hardware, making it difficult to recommend to consumers.
Google discontinued the Pixel Slate tablet line due to a weak commitment to their hardware. Consumers have little reason to stay committed.
The Go uses the same hardware platform as the poorly selling Pixel Slate tablet, which raises concerns about its performance and market success.
There are glaring issues with the Pixel Slate, particularly considering its high price. It has software and hardware problems that reduce its value.
Google killed the Pixel Slate tablet line. It represents a weak commitment to hardware, making it difficult to recommend to consumers.
My Google Pixel Slate has a core i5 processor and 8 gigs of RAM. I would like to share a review and unboxing of it for you.
The Pixel Slate has glaring issues, especially at its current price. It has software and hardware problems, resulting in low performance.
The Pixel Slate is trash and Google deserves criticism for scamming fans with it.
I love my Pixel Slate! Some people just complain about animations for no reason.
I would pick the Surface Book 2 over the Pixel Slate any day.
As an Android fan, I'd still buy the new iPad over this any day.
Why is the Pixel Slate so expensive? Google needs to rethink their strategy.
I can't justify the Pixel Slate's price I might as well switch to Apple.
Google needs to stop copying Apple and make the Pixel Slate cheaper with a keyboard.
I was interested until I saw the price. I bought a cheap Chromebook instead.
Google's product management is so bad they don't see what competitors are doing.
Just get a Surface Pro it's a solid and reliable machine for the price.
The Pixel Slate's screen and speakers seem amazing, but the price is nuts.
Apple or Google are not going to beat the Surface anytime soon, it's better.
The Pixel Slate's price is hilarious Google is faking it until they make it.
Software issues will get fixed, but it's only good for media consumption and expensive.
Every Pixel phone feels half-baked, even the new Pixel 3 phone. iPhones too!
The Surface Pro tops all of these. The iPad Pro destroys the slate as well.
Android apps don't work as well as on tablets, and Chrome slows it down.
I use a cheap Slate for notes and dev work the screen and speakers are great.
I love my Pixel Slate, but it needs a headphone jack and SD card slot.
At $450, the Pixel Slate seems like a no-brainer, but it launched at $1100.
I still love my Pixel Slate and it's running great for web browsing and studying.
My wife loves her Slate, but I wish Google would make a smaller ChromeOS tablet.
I was given a Tab 10 to test out and it was brutal. It wasn't ready.
Thank you for your review. It'll make me think twice about ordering a Duet.
The Pixel Slate is like the Lenovo Duet but more powerful. It's an amazing device now.
I am a fan of my i5 slate. The software these days is quite good.
I have one and I highly recommend it. It's an awesome device.
I love my Pixel Slate for web browsing and videos. It's bearable and the screen is great.
I'm happy with my i5 slate. I prefer it to the iPad, especially the lovely screen.
I appreciate the help and it's giving me more courage to acquire a Slate.
I might return my Slate and get the Pixel Book instead after a week.
I want a Pixel Slate but already have a Pixel Book, so it's hard to justify.
I recommend it the Pixel Slate is a really premium device with fixed problems now.
I love my Pixel Slate. It's fantastic and feels premium with no issues so far.
The Pixel Slate is my primary computing device. It's a great device since day one.
Typical Google/Android is always laggy/buggy for some reason and never improves.
Why doesn't Google take cues from the Surface line that has already been improved?
The press deemed the Pixel Slate a loser, but itâ€™s obviously a great tablet.
I love my M3 Slate, it can do everything a Pixelbook or Chromebook can do.
I still use my i5 Pixel Slate as my daily it's only gotten better since release.
I run an i5 as my daily driver, no complaints. Pen input isn't the best though.
I have an i3 Slate. The screen is nice, but the wifi and keyboard are poor.
